issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h5.Description

When building a project for ws-local it seems that the Windows SDK used by default will be 8.1. Either the Windows SDK should be selected based off the OS version that the user is on or it should default to 10.0
fields.summary: Windows: Default to users OS version when building ws-local projects
fields.environment:
Windows 10 
Appc CLI Core: 5.4.0-35 
Appc CLI NPM: 4.2.7 
Ti SDK: 5.4.0.v20160725003348

comments.body:
Verified. When using {{ws-local}} the default version of windows it now uses is 10.0. 

*Environment*
{code:java}
Operating System
  Name                        = Microsoft Windows 10 Pro
  Version                     = 10.0.14393
  Architecture                = 64bit
  # CPUs                      = 4
  Memory                      = 17034395648

Node.js
  Node.js Version             = 4.4.4
  npm Version                 = 2.11.3

Titanium CLI
  CLI Version                 = 5.0.10

Titanium SDK
  SDK Version                 = 6.1.0.v20161201064221
  SDK Path                    = C:\ProgramData\Titanium\mobilesdk\win32\6.1.0.v20161201064221
  Target Platform             = windows
{code}
